node.title: Texas Non-Profit Announces $50K Annual Fund for Each Offensive Linemen Amid Recruiting Need
node.description: According to "Horns with Hearts," their scholarship fund—"The Pancake Factory"—will cover up to 16 University of Texas scholarship linemen.

node.title: Swiss Catholic Church Appoints Professors to Delve Into Past Sexual Abuse, Produce Report
node.description: The church said it will give researchers "free access to their files and archives where possible and authorized under canonical and state law."

node.title: Elective Surgeries Halted at Over 30 NY Hospitals Due to COVID Surge
node.description: Governor Hochul said the state will avoid a "one-size-fits-all approach" as it decides which hospitals will stop performing elective surgeries.

node.title: Emmett Till's Family Informed Justice Department Has Concluded Investigation Spurred By Book
node.description: Carolyn Donham is quoted in "The Blood of Emmett Till" by Timothy B. Tyson saying that she lied about Till grabbing her, whistling and making sexual advances.

node.title: Defense Bill Would Require Women to Sign Up for Draft, Despite GOP Objections
node.description: "It is wrong to force our daughters, mothers, wives, and sisters to fight our wars," Republican Missouri Senator Josh Hawley has said.

node.title: 10-Year-Old Shoots 13-Year-Old Relative in Face While Playing With Unattended Gun in Bedroom
node.description: They'd been shooting a gun under adult supervision earlier in the day, according to family members.

node.title: Victoria's COVID border exemption scheme was 'unjust', 'inhumane', Ombudsman finds
node.description: Victorian Ombudsman Deborah Glass finds the state's COVID border exemption scheme resulted in "unjust outcomes" for many people stranded outside the state.

node.title: Biologists Concerned After Rare Whale Gives Birth While Entangled in Fishing Rope
node.description: An endangered North Atlantic right whale with a 20-foot fishing rope in its mouth was seen with a newborn calf off the coast of Georgia on Thursday.

node.title: Biden Says Prescription Drugs 'Outrageously Expensive' But Chance for Change Faces Fight
node.description: "I'm committed to using every tool I have to lower prescription drug costs for Americans...," the president said Monday.

node.title: CTU backs Reserve Bank governor amid calls to replace him
node.description: The Council of Trade Unions (CTU) and the head of a KiwiSaver provider are defending the Reserve Bank governor after opposition MPs said he should be replaced.

node.title: Devin Nunes to leave Congress to work for Trump media company
node.description: Trump Media & Technology Group made the announcement. Nunes is leaving before his term ends.

node.title: Officers Jailed For Sharing Photos of Sisters Slain By Man Obsessed With Demons, Lottery
node.description: In a WhatsApp group message that included 41 London officers, Jamie Lewis sent one of the images and referred to the women as "dead birds."

node.title: Woman Says Strangers Stole Her Apartment, Put up Christmas Decorations in Viral Video
node.description: The TikToker said a couple broke into her apartment and stole her dryer, her clothes, shoes and changed the locks.

node.title: Sunoco Agrees to Pay $4 Million, Replace Animal Habitats in Pipeline Spill Settlement
node.description: Sunoco agreed to pay $4 million in a settlement from a 2020 pipeline spill that damaged Marsh Creek State Park in Pennsylvania. The pipeline will change places.

node.title: More American missionary hostages released in Haiti but 12 still held captive
node.description: Three hostages abducted in October have been released amid an incident that has highlighted the Caribbean nation's dire kidnapping problem.

node.title: 'I fully accepted the fact that I was going to lose my foot': UK teen survives croc attack in Zambia
node.description: Amelie Osborn-Smith, 19, says she is "very lucky" to have survived after a crocodile pulled her into a death roll while she was swimming in the Zambezi River during a whitewater rafting trip.

node.title: Police officer's decision to punch bystander justified - IPCA
node.description: A police officer has been exonerated for using force to defend himself after a bystander intervened as he was trying to arrest another man.

node.title: Corporate profits are booming. Could this mean higher wages?
node.description: U.S. corporate profits have never been fatter — or accounted for a bigger portion of economic growth.

node.title: Biden Doesn't Want A War with Russia Over Ukraine
node.description: "The United States is not seeking to end up in a circumstance in which the focus of our countermeasures is the direct use of military force," a senior administration official said.

node.title: $3.5M Stag's Head Among Stolen Antiquities Hedge Fund Manager Must Return, Prosecutor Says
node.description: The Manhattan district attorney said billionaire Michael Steinhardt will have to return $70 million in antiquities illegally smuggled out of 11 countries.

node.title: New Vaccine Ingredient May Battle COVID, Other Illnesses Including HIV: Study
node.description: Scientists found that a new combination adjuvant may boost the effectiveness of a number of inoculations.

node.title: Louisiana Students 16 and Up Likely to Have COVID Shot Added to Required School Vaccines
node.description: Republican lawmakers and Governor John Bel Edwards are debating over whether he can overrule the rejection of his proposed mandate.

node.title: Former GOP Senator Bob Dole to Be 33rd to Lie in State at US Capitol Rotunda
node.description: The former senator and presidential candidate will lie in state Thursday, joining a a list that includes former presidents like JFK and Abraham Lincoln.

node.title: COVID Positivity Rates Soar in 2 Iowa Counties Where Vaccination Rates Are Below 50 Percent
node.description: Two counties in the state, Harrison and Fremont, that have below 50 percent of their eligible populations vaccinated reported positivity rates over 30 percent.

node.title: Strong dairy, meat prices continue to drive record commodity exports
node.description: ANZ Bank's commodities price index rose 2.8 percent in November on the month before, to be 26.1 percent ahead of last year.

node.title: What you need to know about Covid-19 around the world
node.description: Covid-19 responses boost Japanese PM's support, Omicron is in a third of US states, and more - here's what you need to know about the coronavirus right now.

node.title: Department of Justice closing Emmett Till investigation
node.description: The investigation was reopened after a 2017 book quoted Carolyn Bryant Donham as saying she lied when she claimed that Till grabbed her, whistled and made sexual advances.

node.title: Cambodia Says Looter Helping It Reclaim Stolen Artifacts Has Died
node.description: Officials said they plan to continue to use evidence gathered from the reformed looter to pursue the return of many artifacts from museums and private collections.

node.title: Scientist Behind COVID Vaccine Says Next Pandemic Might Be Worse Without More Funding
node.description: "The advances we have made, and the knowledge we have gained, must not be lost," professor Sarah Gilbert said.

node.title: Wisconsin Lawmakers Want Prosecutor Removed Over Low Bail for Suspect in Parade Deaths
node.description: Darrell Brooks Jr. was out on a previous $1,000 bail when the parade incident occurred. District Attorney John Chisholm said the bail was "inappropriately low."
